description:
Client code can send badly formatted requests to the API endpoints. When this happens it results in an ERROR being logged in nova-api.log. This seems incorrect to me. Badly formatted or otherwise incorrect input from a client isn't an error for the API server, merely an inconvenience :)

If we want to record corrupt input in a log somewhere, we should carefully distinguish it from server errors.

Issue observed in 2011.3-d2 + patches
title: nova-api.log should not be logging bad input as ERROR
